comments.commentBody: who would prevent that putative fascist from declaring a state of emergency and assigning himself dictatorial powers?

The scariest part about this article is that it appears that the Pentagon does not understand that it reports to civilian authorities. At a time when a putative fascist is one of the leading parties' candidate for president, this is a very dangerous development.

So then Russia (95% of whose Muslim population is Sunni), may be propping up Assad (leader of the Alowite Shia sect), in his war against everyone, (including ISIS, which is also Sunni), in order to keep them from coming back to Russia and stirring up the Chechans again?

So it may be a mutual threat by ISIS back home that motivates both Putin (an actual existential threat) and Kerry (more terrorism) to make nice. There's more here than meets the eye.
I was read that folks in the ME projection of US interest describe Kerry as the proverbial untethered astronaut, somersaulting through space away from the mother ship.
The Pentagon and Wall Street run Congress. It has been that way for decades. Bernie Sanders may have been a stepping stone in turning that around. surely Trump and Clinton aren't the answer.

I'm sorry but these two distinguished reporters and their editor were wrong to focus on legacies, as if the Syrian tragedy can be reduced to a question of which cabinet member looks better.

There is a huge substantive and moral issue here. President Obama, wisely in my book, refused to commit numbers of ground troops to combat in Syria, after foolishly declaring a red line where a U.S.invasion would have been another disaster. But if he isn't going make "war, war" the President had an obligation, in Churchill's phrase to "jaw. jaw" with Russia to see if the two countries could agree on a practical way to end the slaughter and, if possible, grease Assad's way to the exit.

Moreover, it's not clear from the article if Carter objects to any negotiations with Russia over Syria or to specific aspects of the Kerry-Lavrov agreement. it is the practical differences between the two that should have been the focus of the article, rather than on legacies, which are insubstantial in comparison with the great horror of Syria.
Amen! Carter's specialty seems to be defending and promoting bombers of hospitals.
Might not this be a contrast between the one with bombs and followers who believe in them vs. one who has been in war and believes in talk. I know where I am in this debate.

"In the councils of government, we must guard against the acquisition of unwarranted influence, whether sought or unsought, by the military-industrial complex. The potential for the disastrous rise of misplaced power exists, and will persist." Dwight D. Eisenhower was right about the military power. We need to lessen it's control.
This reset will be different from all the previous resets.

It’s one thing to make a state law telling folks what bathrooms they MUST use, but the kicker was not ALLOWING cities to make their own anti-discriminatory laws.

I have absolutely NO compassion for the “liberal or moderate” cities of Charlotte etc. Get your act together NC!
But these little fellows sometimes get away and end up shooting at us. It is delicate decision requiring much consideration. Not very nice, even less encouraging, to be shot down by your own weapons.

Events are controlling Mr. Obama. He needs to take action.  Either Carter or Kerry must resign. I hope it is Carter. Kerry has a good relationship with the Russian Foreign Minister. Together they may be able to arrange an armistice, whereby Assad steps down and a coalition government takes over.
Agreed. The Chinese and Indians never come to the table when there's a world crisis to tackle. Spineless.

Putin (and the Chinese) have no respect for Obama/Hillary/Kerry.

That's why Putin felt free to invade Europe (Crimea and Ukraine). That's why Chinese don't give a hoot about our complaints and continue to build islands from scratch and install military-grade runways on them.

This nonsense stops on Day 1 with Trump. He's not going to announce red lines and then do nothing when they are crossed.

"If Trump gets in, Assad and Putin will end the conflict and the carnage is likely to be epic, even beyond what has happened to date."

So I guess Obama has decided to preempt Trump by joining in with Assad and Putin first.

Assad is an ultimate Evil destroying his own country and killing his own people, aided by another real Evil, Putin.

This time I think the Pentagon has it right not cooperating with a villain such as Putin. It would only lend legitimacy to Putin and further support him politically.

If we continue to attack ISIS without Putin, his people will grow weary of him supporting an Evil like Assad, thus eroding his support and perhaps having him lose an election. Without Putin in power, Assad would lose support and the war.

If the Pentagon did anything to help, it would be to build a massive military base in Israel to put on the pressure in the region and be a deterrent to protect Israel. After all, they do call themselves the "State of Israel", do they not?

I agree with you Zip, but let's bear in mind that that normality includes torturing and killing kids who write on walls. it's not pretty, but since we can't fix it, we do best, at least in the short term, to stay out militarily.

That said, giving Russia increased knowledge of our targeting capablilities isn't much smarter than giving rebels SAMs.
You forgot to include Anne Marie Slaughter in your list of the merry band of sisters who managed to grasp defeat from the jaws of victory and destabilize the entire Middle East.
Zip gets a gold star for speaking the truth.

REALITY-CHECK: There was no humanitarian crisis in Syria until a bunch of power hungry Warlord/Dictator Wannabe's came to believe that they could manipulate the US into taking down the Ruler. Almost at the same time a wide group ill defined rebels from a wide range of interests decided that they could take over Libya and Syria,
"Tell me how this ends"
Look at Libya, that is what the future Syria would look like, if we pursued the HRC, Susan-Rice, Samantha-Powers agenda, with one big difference. In Syria, ISIS will largely melt into the background, until the best time for them rise up again against a minimal and weak government.

Assad never had, and doesn't have any problems with the civilians in his country. Rationally, he cannot be expected to ignore a rebellion in his country armed and financed by outsiders, including the US.

The insanity of this current scheme is that we are attempting to do a joint program with Russia when our Top-Level objectives are almost exactly opposite.
Russia wants to reinforce Assad
The US wants to force him out of office
* * * *

IMHO, the best approach here would be to help Assad get his country back under control, and back to a peaceful state. Since the US position is opposed to this we should completely remove ourselves from playing games in the mist of somebody else's civil war.
I would suggest turning this whole thing over to Assad & Putin to pacify the country and get it back to a normality that existed before we got involved
Isolationism is a recipe for disaster. Beijing will rule the world if we listen to people like you.

"Though to be honest, she has not succeeded in pointing out that it was the Republicans and Chaffetz who defunded embassy security and are blaming her for what they did."

Furthermore, the Syrian conflict started when Chaffetz was Secretary of State.
Absurd. Civil authorities over control our military and prevent them from doing their main task which is to destroy our many enemies.

John, we might be getting plenty in return for sharing our intelligence, if we actually have any to share: Most of the dirty work gets done by the Russians hunting down ISIL. If that's such a bad deal, why don't we do it all by ourselves?
Not my monkeys, not my circus. Assad's regime has been armed, trained and funded by the Soviets and then Russians for decades, and complicit with Iranian support of terrorism for at least 40 years.

I too support Kerry's plan to give away our intelligence capabilities to the Russians, and getting nothing in return. They've already demonstrated maliciousness in each of these "agreements" except on the subject of missile defense.
Because Carter is a top guy and knows his job.
... and since then Syria has, once again, used chemical weapons against innocents.
Sharing our military information with Putin.  It's right up there with sharing our military training and arms with the Iraqi Army and the Nuclear deal with Iran.
Stupid enough, Mike.

We helped "ease" Saddam and Kadafi out.

How did that work out?

In their place we got ISIS, Islamic State in Syria. ISIS can hardly wait for us to ease Assad out of Syria so as to further complete their conquest.

How stupid can we be?
Ray what mess,we have no one in Syria.
Obama/Clinton got us in this mess. Kerry can't get us out...
Amen!
